intro: Centropogon fasciculatus, commonly known as the clustered false dandelion, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa and the Arabian Peninsula. It is a member of the Acanthaceae family and typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments. The plant features small, clustered flowers that are usually yellow or orange in color, with narrow, lance-shaped leaves. It is often found in rocky soils and can tolerate drought conditions. The species is of interest in botanical studies due to its unique adaptations to harsh climates.
